result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan M Montgomery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan M Montgomery

records.addlTxt: Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($750 sig bond) gj

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of SENTENCING HEARING commencing 06/29/2015 received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 2014CF005064 (51 pages).

Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  PSI reviewed.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT TO CASE 14CF5064, and consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served. 

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on extended supervision on case 14cf5064.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  aw

Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 6/29/2015, branch 3.  Court orders PSI.  PSI order signed and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  State has provided defendant a new offer.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 4/6/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Witness List, received and filed.  aw
State's requested jury instructions received and filed.  aw
State's  motion in limine, received and filed.  aw
Defense motion for modification of bail heard and denied.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel in court, defendant Jonathan M Montgomery not in court, in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 3/2/2015 at 8:30 am, and for jury trial on 4/29/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.   Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel in court, defendant Jonathan M Montgomery not in court, in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Defense counsel has just received an offer from the state.  State stated he turned over an offer earlier.  Defense stated it was not with the discovery that she picked up.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 12/18/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  All motions be filed by the next court date.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for INTENSIVE Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel in court, defendant Jonathan M Montgomery not in court, in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has been picked up on a warrant.  Attorney Saltzwadel has been appointed to represent defendant.  State to provide copy of discovery to defense.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 12/10/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant was picked up on a warrant.  Clerk contacted public defender's office.  Case adjourned for return on warrant on 11/25/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Summary Report received and filed.  aw
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Laurence M. Moon in court.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  aw

Certification of transcript of proceedings of a PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing on 03-19-2014 received and filed. (18 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to ASSISTANT STATE PUBLIC DEFENDER DARRYL SMITH, 819 N 6th Street, 9th Floor, Milwaukee, WI  53203.
Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Nathaniel Adamson for Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #06CF2864 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Dionte King-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/18/14.
css

Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Dennis Murphy for Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was admonished for not appearing yesterday.  Court orders Stayed Bench Warrant withdrawn. Defendant is requesting a Preliminary Hearing.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State requests a bench warrant to issue.  Defense asks the Court to stay a bench warrant.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance.  Status conference scheduled for March 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/7/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Defendant Jonathan M Montgomery in custody.  Francesco G Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
